intro: Pyrola sartorii, commonly known as the purple-flowered wintergreen, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in shaded forest environments, often forming dense colonies. Its flowers, which range from white to deep purple, bloom in late winter or early spring, making it one of the earliest flowering plants in its habitat. Pyrola sartorii is also valued for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
